metadata.title: How to Create YouTube Community Posts 2025: Complete Guide
metadata.description: Master YouTube Community tab. Post types, best practices, and strategies to engage subscribers between videos.

hero.headline: How to Create YouTube Community Posts That Engage
hero.subheadline: Keep your audience engaged between video uploads. Master the Community tab.

sections.content: The Community tab lets you connect with subscribers without uploading videos. Polls, images, text posts, and behind-the-scenes content keep your audience engaged and your channel active. It's underused by most creators. Here's how to use Community posts effectively.

content.title: Polls
content.description: Ask questions and get direct feedback. Highest engagement of all post types.

content.title: Image Posts
content.description: Share photos, memes, and behind-the-scenes content. Visual stops the scroll.

content.title: Text Posts
content.description: Updates, questions, and announcements. Simple but effective for news.

sections.title: How to Create Community Posts
content: Open YouTube Studio on desktop or mobile
Choose post type (text, image, poll, video)

sections.title: Community Post Best Practices
content: Use polls to involve audience in decisions

sections.title: Community Post Ideas
content: Poll: What video should I make next?
Poll: This or that in your niche

faq.question: When do I get the Community tab?
faq.answer: At 500 subscribers. Once unlocked, it's visible on your channel and in YouTube Studio.

faq.question: How often should I post?
faq.answer: 2-4 times per week keeps your audience engaged. More is fine if you have content. Don't spam low-effort posts.

faq.question: Do Community posts affect the algorithm?
faq.answer: They don't directly boost video performance, but they keep subscribers engaged. Engaged subscribers watch more videos.

faq.question: What post types get most engagement?
faq.answer: Polls consistently get highest engagement. They're easy to interact with. Image posts are second. Text posts need compelling questions.
